unnormalised: Bangalore-based startup, CodeNinja, just released v2.5 of their flagship IDE, "DevSpace," packed with AI-powered features. The update promises faster code completion, intelligent debugging, and automated code review. Beta testers are already raving about the 40% reduction in coding time! normalised: Bangalore based startup, CodeNinja, just released version two point five of their flagship I-D-E, "DevSpace," packed with A-I powered features. The update promises faster code completion, intelligent debugging, and automated code review. Beta testers are already raving about the forty percent reduction in coding time! The C-E-O, Mister Rajesh Kumar, says it's a game changer for developers.

unnormalised: The new version supports Python 3.9+, Java 11+, and Node.js 16+, making it compatible with most projects. Plus, they've preponed the release of the premium version, now slated for 15/11/2024. Early bird discounts are available for the 1st 1000 users on their website (CodeNinja.in).
normalised: The new version supports Python three point nine plus, Java eleven plus, and Node dot js sixteen plus, making it compatible with most projects. Plus, they've preponed the release of the premium version, now slated for fifteenth november two thousand and twenty four. Early bird discounts are available for the first one thousand users on their website (CodeNinja dot in).

unnormalised: Industry analysts are predicting a major boost for CodeNinja. Given the increasing demand for skilled developers, tools like DevSpace are more crucial than ever. Priced at Rs. 599/month for individual developers and Rs. 4999/year for teams (upto 5 users), it undercuts competitor offerings significantly.
normalised: Industry analysts are predicting a major boost for CodeNinja. Given the increasing demand for skilled developers, tools like DevSpace are more crucial than ever. Priced at rupees five hundred and ninety nine per month for individual developers and rupees four thousand nine hundred and ninety nine per year for teams (up to five users), it undercuts competitor offerings significantly.
